tet: Boost for Air Force: Govt to purchase 97 LCA Mk1A aircraft; Rs 62,370 crore deal made with HAL
tesyn: The Defence Ministry has signed a significant deal with Hindustan Aeronautics Limited. The agreement involves procuring 97 LCA Mk1A aircraft for the Indian Air Force. This includes 68 fighter jets and 29 twin-seaters. Deliveries are expected to begin in 2027-28. The project emphasizes indigenous content and advanced systems. It will boost self-reliance in defence manufacturing.

C_T: It is high time HAL should be privatised like ISRO providing expertise to private entities allowing their Research labs etc. to private entrepreneurs with strict control on secrecy and technology transfers. HAL in government control can’t execute the manufacturing on faster pace. Private enterprises can do value addition in high technology components and make the jet of cutting edge. What HAL will do will freeze the design but private player will continue to enhance the component quality and overall design. Once HAL get the order it will stop further enhancement. Tejas is stilla developing fighter jet   3-4 years can’t be given for a frozen design. Private entrepreneur will continue enhance the system capabilities.
